heading-order:
Using h1 through h6 element tags in a sequentially-descending order improves accessibility by providing a clear hierarchy and structure to the content. Screen readers and other assistive technologies can easily navigate and understand the content organization. Here's an example of how to use them correctly: ```html Document

Main heading (title of the page or document)

First-level subheading

Some content related to the first-level subheading.

Second-level subheading

Some content related to the second-level subheading.

Third-level subheading

Some content related to the third-level subheading.

Fourth-level subheading

Some content related to the fourth-level subheading.

Fifth-level subheading

Some content related to the fifth-level subheading.

``` In this example, the h1 through h6 elements are used in a sequentially-descending order, starting with the main heading (h1), followed by subheadings (h2 to h6) nested within sections. This provides a clear hierarchy and organization to the content, making it more accessible for users with screen readers and other assistive technologies.
